newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ stocks sluggish at start, mixed session seen.
newsitem.headline: NZ stocks sluggish at start, mixed session seen.

text.p: * Mixed day seen with selective buying amid sluggish tone
* Forestry leaders Carter Holt and Fletcher Forest busy
* Telecom firmly-bid as buyback, bond market help sentiment
LAST CHG * NZSE40 cap index -1.91 at 2,368.91
369 nil * Volume NZ$11.8 million. Futures untraded

Robins said the forestry sector heavyweights like Fletcher Forest, flat at NZ$1.99, and Carter Holt Harvey, up two cents at $3.52, remained in demand from overseas buyers and domestic interest as the world picture for product prices improved.

International interest was also supporting Telecom, which took an early bounce up two cents to $7.14 before steadying around $7.12, and which brokers said appeared to have found a channel between just under $7.10 and $7.20/30 amid the ongoing buyback programme.
Robins noted that the firm bond market of late provided another support layer for Telecom and the forestry stocks.

In the main, however, dealers said the market was maintaining a directionless holding pattern in advance of the government's first budget and the RBNZ's Monetary Policy Statement at the end of next week.
